description: Powerful (1) part of n: if n = Product_i (pi^ei) then a(n) = Product_{i : ei > 1} (pi^ei); if n=b*c^2*d^3 then a(n)=c^2*d^3 when b is minimized.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Index entries for sequences related to powerful numbers
formula: a(n)=n/A055231(n)Multiplicative with a(p)=1 and a(p^e)=p^e for e>1. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Nov 01 2001
example: a(40)=8 since 40=2^3*5 so the powerful part is 2^3=8.
mathematica: rad[n_] := Times @@ First /@ FactorInteger[n]; a[n_] := n/Denominator[n/rad[n]^2]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 97}] (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Jun 20 2013 *)
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Sep 01 2000
